guidance_provided.guidance_value: 74.8% and 75.0%, respectively, plus or minus 50 basis points

guidance_provided.metric: GAAP and non-GAAP other income and expense
guidance_provided.guidance_value: an income of approximately $500 million, excluding gains and losses from non-marketable and publicly-held equity securities
17.0%, plus or minus 1%, excluding any discrete items

management_commentary.speaker: CEO
management_commentary.quote: "Blackwell sales are off the charts, and cloud GPUs are sold out. Compute demand keeps accelerating and compounding across training and inference — each growing exponentially. We’ve entered the virtuous cycle of AI. The AI ecosystem is scaling fast — with more new foundation model makers, more AI startups, across more industries, and in more countries. AI is going everywhere, doing everything, all at once."

new_announcements.announcement: NVIDIA Blackwell achieved the highest performance and best overall efficiency in the SemiAnalysis InferenceMAX benchmarks, while delivering 10x throughput per megawatt compared with the previous generation.
new_announcements.significance: Performance and efficiency of NVIDIA Blackwell

new_announcements.announcement: Announced a strategic partnership with OpenAI to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of NVIDIA systems for OpenAI’s next-generation AI infrastructure.
Unveiled NVIDIA Rubin CPX, a new class of GPU purpose-built for massive-context processing.
Introduced NVIDIA NVQLink™, an open system architecture for tightly coupling the extreme performance of NVIDIA GPU computing with quantum processors.
Launched NVIDIA BlueField-4, the processor for the operating system of AI factories.
Partnered with Nokia to add NVIDIA-powered AI-RAN products to Nokia’s industry-leading RAN portfolio.
Set records on the new MLPerf Inference v5.1 benchmark with NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra, and won every MLPerf Training v5.1 benchmark.
new_announcements.significance: Performance records with NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra

new_announcements.announcement: Launched the world’s first Industrial AI Cloud with Deutsche Telekom to power the AI era of Germany’s industrial transformation.
Announced that NVIDIA is working with the South Korea government and industrial leaders to expand the nation’s AI infrastructure with over a quarter-million NVIDIA GPUs.
new_announcements.significance: Expansion of AI infrastructure in South Korea

notable_items: NVIDIA returned $37.0 billion to shareholders in the form of shares repurchased and cash dividends during the first nine months of fiscal 2026.
NVIDIA will pay its next quarterly cash dividend of $0.01 per share on December 26, 2025, to all shareholders of record on December 4, 2025.
